issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: HDFS bytes-default configurations should accept multiply size units

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: In HDFS-1314, it made the dfs.blocksize can accept different size type like mb, kb, gb, etc. Using "dfs.block.size=8388608" works and  "dfs.block.size=8mb"  also can work, and this type will finally transform to byte format. So we also can make similar property {{dfs.datanode.balance.bandwidthPerSec}} be friendly accepted in size unit.
fields.summary: dfs.datanode.balance.bandwidthPerSec should accept friendly size units

comments.body: Attach a initial patch, kindly review, thanks.
